Sentencas: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) operate at temperatures above 1,100 K where radiation effects can be significant.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: Therefore, an accurate thermal model of an SOFC requires the inclusion of the contribution of thermal radiation.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: This implies that the thermal radiative properties of the oxide ceramics used in the design of SOFCs must be known.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: However, little information can be found in the literature concerning their operating temperatures.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: On the other hand, several types of ceramics with different chemical compositions and microstructures for designing efficient cells are now being tested.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: This is a situation where the use of a numerical tool making possible the prediction of the thermal radiative properties of SOFC materials, whatever their chemical composition and microstructure are, may be a decisive help.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer

Sentencas: Using this method, first attempts to predict the radiative properties of a lanthanum nickelate porous layer deposited onto an yttria stabilized zirconium substrate can be reported.
Titulo: Modelling of the radiative properties of an opaque porous ceramic layer
